coded_answer.p: I am writing to give you some information that you asked for in your letter, which I received this morning.

Your group has been booked ininto the Palace Hotel which is one of the most comfortable hotels in London. Personally, I am glad that you will have this opportunity to use its various facilities. It is basedlocated in the city centre and is about half an hour by underground from the conference. In my oppinionopinion the easiest way to get there from the conference would be by taking the Picadelly line. However you wouldcould take bus number 150, if you would like to have a look at the city centre and you have some free time alsoalso have some free time.

Regarding to the end-of-conference party, I would suggest to wearwearing somea dress for a woman and an elegant suit for a man, though, it is nonot a formal do. The party will finish quite late, so we've decided to provide a bus which wouldwill take you to the hotel safely.

BasicalyBasically, during three hourhours time in the afternoon nobody is able to visit all of the interesting places ofin London. However, you wouldcould havetake a long walk along the river to take some essential photos.
I look forward to welcoming you.
Are you always happy when your telephontelephone ringrings?

As far as I amknow, concerned the telephone was invented in the 19th century. It has been affectingaffected our lifeslives very quickly, although there wereare some different waysmeans of communication assuch as TV, for instance. Since the internetInternet was introduced, many of us wouldn't have imaginedcouldn't have imaginedcan't imagine the lifesliveslife without thisit. We were able evenhave even been able to have our own telephone kept in our pocket for a some time.
However, are you always happy when your personal phone rings.? On the other hand I wonder whether you have experienced some situations when you wouldn't have your mobile switched on.

This invention has affectedchanged my life completely. Since I have been travelingtravelling around the world, I would have imagined beeingbeing in toughtouch with my family or friends without the internetInternet or my mobile phone.

In spite of having the opportunity of keeping in contact with friends at the timetimes when we are far away from home, we should have been knowledgeknow how to use it without interruptingdisturbing others.
